queries.name: IOT platform Wind Turbines faulty

query_draft.draft_text: select turbine_id, prediction as fault, model, state, lat, long, country from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status where prediction != 'ok' limit 18
query_draft.original_query_text: select turbine_id, prediction as fault, model, state, lat, long, country from dbdemos_lakehouse_iot.current_turbine_metrics where prediction != 'ok' limit 18

latest_execution.query_text: select turbine_id, prediction as fault, model, state, lat, long, country from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status where prediction != 'ok' limit 18

queries.query: select turbine_id, prediction as fault, model, state, lat, long, country from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status where prediction != 'ok' limit 18

queries.name: IOT platform Wind Turbines faulty parts

query_draft.draft_text:
select EAN, type, approvisioning_estimated_days, state, count(*) c from (select turbine_id, state, country, prediction as fault, model, lat, long 
from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status where prediction != 'ok' limit 18) as t
left join main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.parts p on t.state=p.stock_location
where stock_available = 0 
group by EAN, type, approvisioning_estimated_days, state
order by c desc
query_draft.original_query_text:
select EAN, type, approvisioning_estimated_days, state, count(*) c from (select turbine_id, state, country, prediction as fault, model, lat, long from dbdemos_lakehouse_iot.current_turbine_metrics where prediction != 'ok' limit 18) as t
left join dbdemos_lakehouse_iot.part p on t.state=p.stock_location
where stock_available = 0 
group by EAN, type, approvisioning_estimated_days, state
order by c desc

latest_execution.query_text:
select EAN, type, approvisioning_estimated_days, state, count(*) c from (select turbine_id, state, country, prediction as fault, model, lat, long 
from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status where prediction != 'ok' limit 18) as t
left join main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.parts p on t.state=p.stock_location
where stock_available = 0 
group by EAN, type, approvisioning_estimated_days, state
order by c desc LIMIT 1000

queries.query:
select EAN, type, approvisioning_estimated_days, state, count(*) c from (select turbine_id, state, country, prediction as fault, model, lat, long 
from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status where prediction != 'ok' limit 18) as t
left join main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.parts p on t.state=p.stock_location
where stock_available = 0 
group by EAN, type, approvisioning_estimated_days, state
order by c desc

query_draft.original_query_text: select sum(avg_energy) as energy_produced, sum(avg_energy) * 110 as revenue_per_hour from dbdemos_lakehouse_iot.current_turbine_metrics

latest_execution.query_text: select sum(avg_energy) as energy_produced, sum(avg_energy) * 110 as revenue_per_hour from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status LIMIT 1000

queries.query: select sum(avg_energy) as energy_produced, sum(avg_energy) * 110 as revenue_per_hour from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status

queries.name: IOT platform Wind Turbines faulty parts count

latest_execution.query_text:
select type, count(*) faulty_equipment_count from (select turbine_id, state, country, prediction as fault, model, lat, long 
from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status  where prediction != 'ok' limit 18) as t
left join main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.parts p on t.state=p.stock_location
where stock_available = 0 
group by type
order by faulty_equipment_count desc LIMIT 1000

visualizations.name: Recurrent equipment default over the last year

queries.query:
select type, count(*) faulty_equipment_count from (select turbine_id, state, country, prediction as fault, model, lat, long 
from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status  where prediction != 'ok' limit 18) as t
left join main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.parts p on t.state=p.stock_location
where stock_available = 0 
group by type
order by faulty_equipment_count desc

queries.name: IOT platform Wind Turbines stats faulty

query_draft.draft_text:
with test as (select status, sum(avg_energy) as energy_produced, avg(avg_energy) as avg_energy, count(*)/10 as count from 
(select *, case when prediction == 'ok' then 'ok' else 'faulty' end as status from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status ) 
group by status)

select *, avg_energy/other_status_avg_energy*10 as efficiency_loss from (select *, LAG(avg_energy, -1) OVER (ORDER BY status) as other_status_avg_energy from test)

-- , LAG(avg_energy) OVER (ORDER BY status) as other_status_avg_energy, other_status_avg_energy/avg_energy
query_draft.original_query_text:
with test as (select status, sum(avg_energy) as energy_produced, avg(avg_energy) as avg_energy, count(*)/10 as count from 
(select *, case when prediction == 'ok' then 'ok' else 'faulty' end as status from dbdemos_lakehouse_iot.current_turbine_metrics ) 
group by status)

select *, avg_energy/other_status_avg_energy*10 as efficiency_loss from (select *, LAG(avg_energy, -1) OVER (ORDER BY status) as other_status_avg_energy from test)

-- , LAG(avg_energy) OVER (ORDER BY status) as other_status_avg_energy, other_status_avg_energy/avg_energy

(select *, case when prediction == 'ok' then 'ok' else 'faulty' end as status from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status ) 
group by status)

select *, avg_energy/other_status_avg_energy*10 as efficiency_loss from (select *, LAG(avg_energy, -1) OVER (ORDER BY status) as other_status_avg_energy from test) LIMIT 1000

-- , LAG(avg_energy) OVER (ORDER BY status) as other_status_avg_energy, other_status_avg_energy/avg_energy

group by status)

dashboard.name: IOT Platform - Wind Turbine predictive maintenance

widgets.text:
# Maintenance part analysis & recommendation

Based on our Predictive maintenance model and our stock status, we are able to provide recommendation to better organize our stock and potentially adjust spare parts command.  

The potential use-cases and potential revenue optimizations are huge. As other example we can also run analysis on the faulty equipment history and potentially detect frequent issues to take preventive action on the hardware.

options.description: The following wind turbines have a potential default and should be inspected

query.name: IOT platform Wind Turbines faulty
query.query: select turbine_id, prediction as fault, model, state, lat, long, country from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status where prediction != 'ok' limit 18

options.title: Parts for faulty Wind Turbine having no stock in the turbine region
options.description: The following parts are not available close to the faulty wind turbine. Stocks need to be adjusted accordingly.

query.name: IOT platform Wind Turbines faulty parts
query.query:
select EAN, type, approvisioning_estimated_days, state, count(*) c from (select turbine_id, state, country, prediction as fault, model, lat, long 
from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status where prediction != 'ok' limit 18) as t
left join main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.parts p on t.state=p.stock_location
where stock_available = 0 
group by EAN, type, approvisioning_estimated_days, state
order by c desc

query.query:
select type, count(*) faulty_equipment_count from (select turbine_id, state, country, prediction as fault, model, lat, long 
from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status  where prediction != 'ok' limit 18) as t

with test as (select status, sum(avg_energy) as energy_produced, avg(avg_energy) as avg_energy, count(*)/10 as count from 
(select *, case when prediction == 'ok' then 'ok' else 'faulty' end as status from main__build.dbdemos_iot_turbine.turbine_current_status ) 
group by status)

select *, avg_energy/other_status_avg_energy*10 as efficiency_loss from (select *, LAG(avg_energy, -1) OVER (ORDER BY status) as other_status_avg_energy from test)

-- , LAG(avg_energy) OVER (ORDER BY status) as other_status_avg_energy, other_status_avg_energy/avg_energy
